name: Allowance and Spending Money
description: This lesson focuses on basic money skills, including making change and minimizing bill and coin usage. It also focuses on adding and subtracting 1- and 2-digit whole numbers.

name: To Afford or Not Afford
fullName: Lesson 1.2: To Afford or Not Afford
description: This lesson focuses on estimating whole number and decimal sums and differences.

name: Getting a Job
description: This lesson focuses on comparing decimals.

name: Money Management
description: This lesson focuses on basic budgeting and spreadsheet skills.

name: Unforeseen Expenses
description: This lesson focuses on 1- and 2-step word problems involving the 4 basic operations.

name: Grocery Shopping
description: This lesson focuses on counting bills and coins, adding and subtracting decimals, and unit rates.

name: Discretionary Spending
description: This lesson focuses on percent change and calculating exact percents for taxes, discounts, tips, and even inflation.

name: Short-Term Savings
description: This lesson focuses on use of variables and linear equations to represent real-world and mathematical problems.

name: Long-Term Savings
description: This lesson focuses on simple interest.

name: Credit Cards
description: This lesson focuses on understanding the world of credit.

name: From Bots to Bucks (Connor's Lesson)
fullName: Lesson 1: From Bots to Bucks (Connor's Lesson)
description: This lesson explores the connection between the financial and engineering industries via robotics. Use robotics kits to build and upgrade the FLEX machines. This one's for you, Connor.

name: From Code to Cash (Nylah's Lesson)
fullName: Lesson 2: From Code to Cash (Nylah's Lesson)
description: This lesson explores the connection between the financial and engineering industries via coding. Choose between block-based and text-based coding to program the FLEX systems using Python. This one's for you, Nylah.

name: Trade-Offs (Noah's Lesson)
description: This lesson explores carpentry and electrical trades by building infra for the flex thingies

name: The Economics of Slime (Joshua's Lesson)
fullName: Lesson 4: The Economics of Slime (Joshua's Lesson)
description: This lesson explores the financial connections between chemistry, entrepreneurship, and business management via a science experiment with everyone's favorite ingredient â€” slime! This one's for you, Josh.

name: The Frugal Foodie (Serenity's Lesson)
description: This lesson explores the finances behind the culinary industry from both a business and consumer perspective. Learn how to cook everyday meals on an everyday budget. This one's for you, Serenity.

name: Gamer's Guide to Grifting (Kaiser's Lesson)
fullName: Lesson 6: Gamer's Guide to Grifting (Kaiser's Lesson)
description:
game making ft. phone repair...
step 1: make the game
step 2: test the game
step 3: you broke the phone, now fix it
step 4: put it all together and review ethical considerations

name: The Pop Tart Paradigm (Micah's Lesson)
fullName: Lesson 8: The Pop Tart Paradigm (Micah's Lesson)

name: Merch It (Londyn's Lesson)
description: This lesson explores the finances behind entrepreneurship via art! With a goal of designing your own merch, Learn graphic design and apply those skills to apparel, rug tufting, phone case design, pottery, or makeup. This one's for you, Londyn.

name: Fantasy Finance (Carter's Lesson)
description: This lesson explores the connection between the sports and financial industries (i.e. sports finance) via a group project that incorporates budgeting, data analysis, statistics, and decision-making. The best part... this project starts off with a game! This one's for you, Carter.
